cleaned_summary: the investigation conducted by the itf clearly documented that prishtina airport management failed to perform their duties in accordance with the general principles outlined above in particular the use of the assets allocated to the atcs by the kta in was inadequately documented and the performance of the atcs finance office in that respect was unsatisfactory this poor performance even caused financial damage to the unmik pillar kta as demonstrated in this report the work of the atcs finance office was under direct supervision of the atcs official and the oversight responsibility was in the hands of the division manager both of them in their respectful capacity failed to perform their duties according to expected standards and they failed to promote the best interest of unmik pillar kta as their employer
summary: The investigation conducted by the itf clearly documented that prishtina airport management failed to perform their duties in accordance with the general principles outlined above. The use of the assets allocated to the atcs by the kta in was inadequately documented and the performance of the  finance office in that respect was unsatisfactory.

cleaned_summary: documentation obtained by the itf from the prishtina airport clearly shows that atcs management failed to introduce or enforce rules and regulations that would guarantee proper use of the allocated funds and provided transparent documentation of this process a significant amount of the cash withdrawals by the atcs was used for training opportunities for employees of the atcs who attended courses in a number of countries including italy canada and the united kingdom therefore the cash advances were not all related to the atcs officials travel rather for a significant number of employees the necessity of the frequent travel of the atcs official remains questionable as the available documentation does not provide clear proof that the atcs officials travel was business related or justified
summary: A significant amount of the cash withdrawals by the atcs was used for training opportunities for employees. The atcs failed to introduce or enforce rules and regulations that would guarantee proper use of the funds.

cleaned_summary: the atcs official stated that in heshe was not sufficiently experienced in financial management therefore heshe hired finance officer and finance officer who both had educational background and professional experience in this field heshe said that heshe was sure that the atcs money was spent in line with the requests but heshe accepted that the documentation was very poor and unacceptable even for the minimal standards required the atcs official agreed that heshe and hisher staff were diligent in requesting funds for atcs operations however were generally deficient when addressing the need for proper documentation of the actual expenditures the atcs official indicated that heshe trusted hisher staff that they were professional and it was only very recently that heshe realized that heshe should have devoted more effort to their supervision
summary: The documentation was very poor and unacceptable even for the minimal standards required the atcs official agreed that heshe and hisher staff were diligent in requesting funds for atcs operations. However were generally deficient when addressing the need for proper documentation of the actual expenditures.

cleaned_summary: the atcs official further indicated that hisher superiors approved all the bills that were in the petty cash binders including for example present for international staff present for official nokia palm organizer for the atcs official and official recharging scratch cards vala payment for mobile phone and rent a car for head of department the atcs official stated that all the presents purchased from petty cash were also approved however heshe could not support this claim with any documentation the atcs official added that had those bills not been authorized the atcs would have not been able to get further cash as the approval for further cash withdrawals was conditioned by proper documentation and certification of previous spending heshe insisted that the sums paid for refreshmentsfoodrestaurant bills from the petty cash fund hundreds of euros were all authorized by hisher superiors but that they did not request written justifications from himher the bill was allegedly sufficient proof of expenditure
summary: The atcs official indicated that hisher superiors approved all the bills that were in the petty cash binders including for example present for international staff present for official nokia palm organizer. The official insisted that the sums paid for refreshmentsfoodrestaurant bills from the pettycash fund hundreds of euros were all authorized.

cleaned_summary: the itf interviewed the atcs official on two occasions and heshe acknowledged that cases and the time period up to june all show numerous irregularities heshe studied those files in detail and concluded that all four contained sufficient information to justify the allocation of money for the planned travel of the atcs staff but that the documentation of the expenses was very poor the atcs official also acknowledged that cases and the time period after july also showed numerous irregularities such as missing bills to prove payments missing signatures of atcs staff proving that they had received the perdiem missing flight ticket and boarding passes proving that the travel was in fact executed the itf concluded that it is very likely that those funds were paid to the atcs employees on perdiem or salaries however sufficient documentation to prove those payments was not available to the itf investigators despite numerous attempts made in order to secure such documentation as a matter of practice the atcs official was formally certifying hisher own expenses during the business trips the atcs official could not provide any acceptable explanations to those irregularities
summary: The itf interviewed the atcs official on two occasions and heshe acknowledged that cases and the time period up to june all show numerous irregularities. sufficient documentation to prove those payments was not available to the itf investigators despite numerous attempts made to secure such documentation.

cleaned_summary: the division manager said that the atcs official would bring to himher a request in which heshe would detail the need for cash and that when the division manager found the justification sufficient and in line with needs of the airport heshe would approve it the atcs official would then be responsible for the proper use of these funds and keeping the financial records of the expenditure in fact the atcs official had to sign for the bank check before it could be cashed at the bank and therefore heshe had the cash in hisher custody the division manager indicated that it was not possible for himher to check every bill and invoice therefore he she delegated the authority for financial management to the atcs official
summary: division manager said that the atcs official would bring to himher a request in which heshe would detail the need for cash and that when the division manager found the justification sufficient and in line with needs of the airport he she would approve it. The official would then be responsible for the proper use of these funds and keeping the financial records of the expenditure.

cleaned_summary: the itf interviewed official at prishtina airport heshe stated that in may heshe travelled with the atcs official and official to the uk in order to negotiate conditions and finetune the training arrangements for the atcs staff request during this mission they all received free accommodation all meals were provided as well as transport from shinfield park to london upon their return when heshe returned to prishtina heshe was not requested to return any of the perdiem adding that heshe knew that the atcs official and official also did not return any of the allocated funds
summary: The itf interviewed official at prishtina airport heshe stated that in may heshe travelled with the atcs official and official to the uk in order to negotiate conditions and finetune the training arrangements. All received free accommodation all meals were provided as well as transport from shinfield park to london upon their return. When heshe returned to prishTina heshe was not requested to return any of the perdiem.

cleaned_summary: background information a review of the airports bank accounts and documents related to airport operations contracts and financial matters revealed a number of cash withdrawals from the atcs bank account many of them in increments between july and november an amount of was withdrawn in cash the majority of the withdrawals were identified as being for air travel and related expenses for the then the atcs official similarly for other atcs employees and also for the socalled petty cash purposes the forensic audit report of february highlighted that the atcs official travelled frequently and questioned whether the trips were necessary or were approved it was established that on july the new division manager airport sector unmik pillar was appointed with overall responsibility for pristina airport the atcs official was in charge of the department which included day today management of the atcs finance office finance officer and finance officer were employed as atcs finance officers both of them directly supervised by the atcs official it should be also mentioned that the atcs official finance officer and finance officer were working at atcs prior to the arrival of the division manager
summary: A review of the airports bank accounts and documents related to airport operations contracts and financial matters revealed a number of cash withdrawals from the atcs bank account. The majority of the withdrawals were identified as being for air travel and related expenses for the then atcs official.

cleaned_summary: iv investigative details the itf investigation was focused on the examination of two main areas a travel arrangements and cash expenses related to the official travel of atcs staff and b handling of the socalled atcs petty cash during this investigation the itf investigators reviewed existing procedures related to the cash withdrawals in and in view of establishing whether those procedures were properly followed and enforced by the management of atcs examined atcs bank account and related records examined the cash withdrawal requests supporting documentation and receipts including airline tickets hotel bills and other receipts
summary: The investigation was focused on the examination of two main areas a travel arrangements and cash expenses related to the official travel of atcs staff and b handling of the socalled atcs petty cash. Itf investigators reviewed existing procedures related to cash withdrawals in and in view of establishing whether those procedures were properly followed.

cleaned_summary: the itf investigation was focused on the examination of two main areas a travel arrangements and cash expenses related to the official travel of atcs staff and b handling of the socalled atcs petty cash during this investigation the itf investigators reviewed the socalled petty cash files and related documentation crosschecked the staff details on record and their employment roles during the time period in question including their official right to authorize cash withdrawals from atcs bank account compared signatures found on the examined documents against the signatures on the staff files crosschecked specific sums against the airport excel cash spreadsheets and the master bank account note the excel spreadsheet system has been in place since mid and is used to maintain a cashbook interviewed atcs staff in particular the division manager the atcs officials and finance officers and itf investigators also interviewed official at prishtina airport and the official at prishtina airport
summary: The itf investigation was focused on the examination of two main areas a travel arrangements and cash expenses related to the official travel of atcs staff and b handling of the socalled atcs petty cash.

cleaned_summary: during the review of available documentation the itf investigators identified a number of problems related to the existing procedures and practices at atcs finance office having finalized the document review they interviewed available atcs staff that was directly involved in approving the cash withdrawals and subsequently atcs staff that handled the cash and related documentation at the atcs finance office or that travelled on training to italy and the united kingdom the itf interviewed finance officer working at atcs finance office during the period september to december finance officer described the procedures that were in place during and and identified employee employee and the division manager as a class signatories and employee employee employee and the atcs official as b class signatories for the unmik aviation transport and airport prishtina bank accounts those listed a class signatories were the only people authorized to withdraw cash from the atcs bank accounts
summary: The itf investigators identified a number of problems related to the existing procedures and practices at atcs finance office. during the review of available documentation the itf Investigators identified anumber of problems.

cleaned_summary: with regards to performance and conduct of the employees of kta the following unmik regulation shall apply unmik regulation no dated october on essential labour law in kosovo section termination of a labour contract states the following extract serious misconduct shall include the following a unjustified refusal to perform the obligations set out in the labour contract b theft destruction damage or unauthorized use of the employers assets c disclosure of business secrets d consumption of drugs or alcohol at work and e behavior of such a serious nature that it would be unreasonable to expect the employment relationship to continue unsatisfactory performance shall include the following a unjustified absence from work and b repeated mistakes not sufficient in themselves to justify a dismissal but which given their frequency and seriousness disrupt the normal course of the employment relationship
summary: serious misconduct shall include the following a unjustified refusal to perform the obligations set out in the labour contract b theft destruction damage or unauthorized use of the employers assets c disclosure of business secrets d consumption of drugs or alcohol at work and e behavior of such a serious nature that it would be unreasonable to expect the employment relationship to continue unsatisfactory performance.

cleaned_summary: the itf interviewed finance officer working at the atcs finance office who stated heshe has been employed by the atcs since april finance officer provided detailed information with regard to the financial procedures and practices at the atcs finance office and indicated that based on hisher previous experience in dealing with finances for a number of companies local and international heshe found the atcs finance office to be quite disorganized for example the office did not have in place proper structures and computer software to deal with the financial issues including cash even though the amounts of money they were processing were quite high finance officer allegedly tried to suggest some improvements but the atcs official told himher that it was the way the unmik wanted to deal with money and that heshe should follow hisher instructions since finance officer was concerned that heshe might lose hisher job if heshe raised any further objections heshe decided to work as instructed by the atcs official
summary: The itf interviewed finance officer working at the atcs finance office. The finance officer said heshe found the office to be quite disorganized. The office did not have in place proper structures and computer software to deal with financial issues including cash.

cleaned_summary: the itf interviewed official at the pristina airport official was requested to review several files related to business travel of atcs staff during and was shown documents and heshe concluded that all four might contain sufficient information to justify allocation of funds for the planned travel of atcs staff however none had sufficient information that would document how those allocated funds were spent information contained in the file suggests that this document might have been created afterthefact as had this request been submitted for approval on may as indicated it would be impossible for the approval dates written on the document to be may and may respectively also documents attached to request were printouts indicating flight reservations but they do not prove that the travel was executed none of the four files contained original flight tickets boarding passes or original bills nor do they contain sufficient proof that all the funds allocated to the travellers were provided to them by the atcs official as the travellers did not sign for them without flight tickets and boarding passes it is not sufficiently documented that the atcs personnel travelled on those missions
summary: Itf interviewed official at the pristina airport official was requested to review several files related to business travel of atcs staff during and was shown documents. He concluded that all four might contain sufficient information to justify allocation of funds for the planned travel. None had sufficient information that would document how those allocated funds were spent.

cleaned_summary: official was also requested to review the files dated after july in particular files and having studied those files heshe concluded that the files revealed the same absence of required documentation as the other cases identified in paragraph above official was asked to review several files related to the socalled petty cash transactions and see whether there were any irregularities heshe concluded that significant efforts were made by the atcs official to justify the cash withdrawals however while the cash appeared to have been provided there was very little effort to properly document how those funds were spent
summary: Official was asked to review several files related to the socalled petty cash transactions and see whether there were any irregularities heshe concluded that significant efforts were made by the atcs official to justify the cash withdrawals. While the cash appeared to have been provided there was very little effort to properly document how those funds were spent.

cleaned_summary: itf investigators interviewed the division manager on two occasions and heshe explained that staff travel expenses were high because of the necessity to train nineteen air traffic controllers seven meteorological forecasters and six aeronautical information service officers all of the above staff received classroom and onthejob training around the world and that pristina airport was responsible for expenses incurred heshe said that the airport has no rules or regulations regarding travel and that there are no forms to complete requesting authorization for travel or documentation authorizing travel the division manager was aware that the atcs official as the supervisor of many of those who travelled would frequently visit staff whilst undertaking their respective courses
summary: Staff travel expenses were high because of the necessity to train nineteen air traffic controllers seven meteorological forecasters and six aeronautical information service officers all of the above staff received classroom and onthejob training around the world. Pristina airport was responsible for expenses incurred.

cleaned_summary: finance officer also confirmed that the division manager and the atcs official supervised the work of the atcs finance office heshe further indicated that whenever there was a requirement for a larger cash payment for example an official travel finance officer or finance officer would prepare a request for cash withdrawal that would be signed by the atcs official and subsequently assessed and approved by the division manager finance officer was given the opportunity to review documentation related to the travel of atcs staff in prior to the takeover of the atcs by unmik pillar kta on july during this exercise finance officer established that requests for cash and had proper justification sufficient for the authorization of cash allocation but all lacked documentation that would indicate how those funds were spent finance officer was not able to provide satisfactory explanations for the identified irregularities and had no recollection that the atcs official ever made any checks of the financial files at atcs finance office
summary: Finance officer was given the opportunity to review documentation related to the travel of atcs staff in prior to the takeover of the atcs by unmik pillar kta on july during this exercise finance officer established that requests for cash and had proper justification sufficient for the authorization of cash allocation but all lacked documentation that would indicate how those funds were spent.

cleaned_summary: finance assistant claimed he had not noticed the footer on them when idoios asked why the photocopies of the forged faxes in the undp finance file did not have the footer he disclaimed responsibility for the photocopying at the time of these incidents two photocopying assistants had been working on an ad hoc basis at the finance office and had access to departmental files photocopying assistant was a relative of the finance department supervisor and photocopying assistant was the daughter of finance assistant photocopying assistant assisted her father periodically without pay oios was informed that the two assistants helped in the preparation of the end of month financial returns which included retrieving documents from various files copying them and returning them to the files photocopying assistant was working at the finance office at the relevant time period but it has not been fully established when photocopying assistant worked at the office no timesheets were kept for either assistant review of procedures at unon unep narobi and undp bratislava in connection with payments of this sort showed that undp bratislava relies on the authorizing signatures on the faxes and does not verify their authenticity with the agency undp bratislava maintains a signin sheet which requires a signature and identity information but it was kept haphazardly at the time of these incidents undp bratislava disperses cheques upon proof of identity which is recorded on the back of the cheque and the payee signs the original cash disbursement voucher upon receipt of the cheque but the finance office does not retain a copy of the payees proof of identification undp bratislava does not maintain a mail log while procedures for reconciling accounts between unon and undp were in place unon did not attempt to reconcile the august undp bratislava account for more than a year after it was purportedly submitted and unep narobi stated that it has had several problems with fraudulent payments by undp offices
summary: Two photocopying assistants had been working on an ad hoc basis at the finance office and had access to departmental files. finance assistant claimed he had not noticed the footer on them. unon did not attempt to reconcile the august undp bratislava account for more than a year after it was purportedly submitted.

cleaned_summary: emails by the staff member to mr mzumara oic sro lusaka on january the staff member wrote an email to mr dickson mzumara officerincharge of the eca sub regional office in lusaka zambia confirming that he had written to ambassador negroponte because he had had a chat with friends who thought that this was too much of a hot potato mr mzumara was also a recipient of a copy of the email that was addressed to ambassador negroponte by the staff member on the same day mr mzumara replied through an email to the staff member and concurred with his action of writing to the ambassador however mr mzumara pointed out to the staff member that he was concerned that he the staff member was writing to persons outside the organization mr mzumara stated that yes i thought as much my concern was you were going out of the system and this is not in line with the conditions of service see what comes out of it the staff member responded via email dated january and stated that thanks that i have been told this question was brought in the jab in nairobi with a few phone calls the case was shelved the lady who broadcasted the message is the one who wrote to white house and the vice presidents of the usa if the internal justice system had functioned every thing would have been kept within the system my hope was negroponte being in the un secretariat would do damage control and get somehow the boss to address the problem in the best interest of the secretary general the ladies will continue writing to human rights organizations especially those that are tired it may not produce immediate results but a lot of damage will be done he added that he wrote to the ambassador to show the man that dialogue is the best option in life
summary: The staff member wrote an email to mr dickson mzumara officerincharge of the eca sub regional office in lusaka zambia confirming that he had written to ambassador negroponte because he had had a chat with friends who thought that this was too much of a hot potato. The staff member responded via email dated january and stated that thanks that i have been told this question was brought in the jab in nairobi with a few phone calls the

cleaned_summary: during the course of the investigation it was revealed that on january an anonymous person using the identities of hiwot abebe sent an email to the president and vicepresident of the united states of america the email was also addressed to senator john kerry and senator dodd of the united states senate the email had an attachment that was addressed to the executive secretary of eca and highlighted allegations of sexual harassment and rape perpetrated by some senior officials of eca within the eca complex the title to the attachment was crimes of rape and maladministration within the compound of eca the document was also copied to the secretarygeneral ethiopian foreign ministry and senior officials in the un system abebes complaint to the american government was that the executive secretary eca had failed to take action against staff members who were alleged to have sexually harassed and raped ten women staff members of eca abebe was therefore asking the american government to intervene on behalf of the aggrieved women the above email and the attachment were copied to the staff member and other persons working in the organization
summary: An anonymous person using the identities of hiwot abebe sent an email to the president and vicepresident of the united states of america. The email had an attachment that was addressed to the executive secretary of eca and highlighted allegations of sexual harassment and rape perpetrated by some senior officials.

cleaned_summary: introduction the investigations division of the office of internal oversight services oios received several emails sent to persons external to the organization which alleged that wrongdoings were committed at the economic commission for africa eca but no action was taken one of the authors of the said emails was a staff member of eca subsequently an investigation was conducted that revealed that contrary to un rules and regulations the staff member sent emails to his excellency ambassador john negroponte of the us mission to the un the president and vicepresident of the united states of america senator john kerry and senator dodd of the united states senate amongst others
summary: emails alleged that wrongdoings were committed at the economic commission for africa eca but no action was taken. One of the authors of the said emails was a staff member of eca. An investigation was conducted that revealed that contrary to un rules and regulations.

cleaned_summary: applicable law regulation i of the staff regulations provides that staff members shall exercise the utmost discretion with regard to all matters of official business they shall not communicate to any government entity person or any other source any information known to them by reason of their official position that they know or ought to have known has not been made public except as appropriate in the normal course of their duties or by authorization of the secretarygeneral these obligations do not cease upon separation from service methodology oios investigation of this matter entailed obtaining and analyzing relevant documents staff members were also interviewed including the staff member background information the staff member worked in eca at the p level he retired at the end of november having worked for the organization for over years
summary: Staff members exercise the utmost discretion with regard to all matters of official business. Staff members shall not communicate to any government entity person or any other source any information known to them by reason of their official position.

cleaned_summary: investigative details hiwot abebe email of january during the course of the investigation it was revealed that on january an anonymous person using the identities of hiwot abebe sent an email to the president and vicepresident of the united states of america the email was also addressed to senator john kerry and senator dodd of the united states senate the email had an attachment that was addressed to the executive secretary of eca and highlighted allegations of sexual harassment and rape perpetrated by some senior officials of eca within the eca complex the title to the attachment was crimes of rape and maladministration within the compound of eca the document was also copied to the secretarygeneral ethiopian foreign ministry and senior officials in the un system
summary: An anonymous person using the identities of hiwot abebe sent an email to the president and vicepresident of the united states of america. The email had an attachment that was addressed to the executive secretary of eca and highlighted allegations of sexual harassment and rape perpetrated by some senior officials of the eca complex.

cleaned_summary: v investigative details when interviewed the acgd officer told idoios that official had asked him to pay miscellaneous expenses and dsa to the participants of the seychelles conference he said that eca had written to undp mauritius who asked undp hq for authority to transfer funds to barclays in seychelles the acgd officer then cashed the funds and disbursed dsa to participants he said that on february he paid the first group of participants at the hotel in the presence of the undp officer he indicated his payment to participants on the list by placing asterisks against their names on february barclays paid the other participants using the attendance list supplied by the acgd officer upon receipt of identification from the payees the bank tellers had the participant sign hisher name on the attendance list and paid the dsa the acgd officer said that he was present when the bank tellers paid the remaining participants and that after the payments were made the attendance list was returned to him
summary: eca had written to undp mauritius who asked undp hq for authority to transfer funds to barclays in seychelles. The acgd officer then cashed the funds and disbursed dsa to participants.

cleaned_summary: v investigative details the acgd officer explained these discrepancies by suggesting that a bank employee might have tampered with the dsa list and forged signatures of participants who did not attend and then pocketed their dsa he said that he dealt with the manager a teller and a gobetween person and that any one of them could have falsely signed the dsa list however he had previously acknowledged that he had witnessed the payments being made by the bank staff and he had not raised any questions or concerns then or at any time before being questioned by idoios investigators on this point however he claimed to be surprised by the discrepancies pointed out by idoios he then acknowledged that he had received memoranda from official asking him to account amongst other things for the moneys that he had been given for dsa but he thought that the matter had been settled despite the unaccounted discrepancies
summary: The acgd officer suggested that a bank employee might have tampered with the dsa list and forged signatures of participants who did not attend. He said that he dealt with the manager a teller and a gobetween person and that any one of them could have falsely signed the list.

cleaned_summary: the evidence adduced for allegation shows that unep staff member received an appointment with pcau in may about a year after she began work for the btf as a consultant both she and unep staff member subsequently received highlevel contracts unep management advised idoios that unep staff member and unep staff member performed well which they felt justified their decision to grant them contracts at the high level although unep staff member did not have the requisite educational background and unep staff member had little environmental expertise prior to his consultancy with btf this allegation could not be substantiated
summary: The evidence adduced for allegation shows that unep staff member received an appointment with pcau in may about a year after she began work for the btf as a consultant. Both she and unepStaff member subsequently received highlevel contracts.

cleaned_summary: the investigations division of the office of internal oversight services idoios received a report of alleged wrongdoing in the balkans task force btf and in the postconflict assessment unit pcau of the united nations environment programme unep the complaints are against two unep staff members and a unepipcau consultant all of whom are from the same country and had previously worked together i allegation while working for the btf and pcau unep staff member unep staff member and uneppcau consultant maintained an ongoing relationship with their former company thereby creating a conflict of interest ii allegation unep staff member demanded a kickback of fifty percent of consultancy fees paid to experts and these fees were shared with unep staff member and uneppcau consultant
summary: Complaints are against two unep staff members and a unepipcau consultant all of whom are from the same country and had previously worked together. Allegations include that one staff member demanded a kickback of fifty percent of consultancy fees paid to experts.

cleaned_summary: the evidence adduced for allegation shows that unep staff member and uneppcau consultant did not at any time have a financial relationship with the former company however the btf had a series of contracts and extensions of those contracts with the former company and unep staff member was a shareholder and senior officer of the former company and as a subcontractor of the former company worked for the btf during the time unep staff member held a consultancy contract with unep the former company had no contractual relationship with unep although this created the appearance of a conflict of interest none was established
summary: Evidence adduced for allegation shows that unep staff member and uneppcau consultant did not at any time have a financial relationship with the former company. However the btf had a series of contracts and extensions of those contracts with theFormer company and unep Staff member was a shareholder and senior officer of the Former Company. The former company had no contractual relationship with unep.

cleaned_summary: during the course of the investigation idoios learned that the former company received contracts and extensions of contracts with btf through unops without competitive bidding in violation of financial regulation which states that procurement functions include all actions necessary for the acquisition by purchase or lease of property including products and real property and of services including works the following general principles shall be given due consideration when exercising the procurement functions of the united nations a best value for money fairness integrity and transparency c effective international competition d the interest of the united nations in conclusion idoios finds that unep and unops departed from united nations rules and regulations as described above these irregularities seem not to have been carried out in bad faith because the urgency of the situation necessitated that btf become operational rapidly however once operational both organisations should have taken measures to rectify the problems identified in the allegations
summary: idoios learned that the former company received contracts and extensions of contracts with btf through unops without competitive bidding in violation of financial regulation. The irregularities seem not to have been carried out in bad faith because the urgency of the situation necessitated that btf become operational rapidly.

cleaned_summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik including official and official pillar ii supervised the department of transport and infrastructure doti official the doti was later known as the transport sector of the unmik directorate of infrastructure affairs doti official left unmik at the end of june doti official was recruited by the doti as an international staff member on july in charge of airport operations reporting to doti official and continued in this role until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from the armed forces of a united nations member state specifically airport engineer i airport engineer and airport engineer and later by the consultant from the consulting firm on july the responsibility for the administration of the airport passed from pillar ii to the kosovo trust agency kta and pillar iv the divisional manager was appointed at the airport sector kta at the same time under him were the peap official and the air traffic control services atcs official on april pristina international airport which had until that time been under the jurisdiction of kfor was handed over to civilian jurisdiction under icao regulations it is against this background of change that procurement procedures relating to the following contract have been examined
summary: Pristina international airport was handed over to civilian jurisdiction under icao regulations on april 2013. until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration. Engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from the armed forces of a united nations member state.

cleaned_summary: further in interviews with the itf the airport personnel did not know whether the icaa was required to follow unmik procurement protocols however a kta internal audit department staff member confirmed that no breaches of kta rules unmik procurement rules or the abovementioned agreement could be identified in the purchase of the new policy through the icaa the itf further concludes that unmik procurement rules were not applicable to the icaa as the agreement between unmik and the icaa for the government of iceland is prevailing and does not identify such a requirement there is also no evidence of improper collusion or negotiations during the requisitioning process of the insurance policy nor is no evidence that the process was corrupted finally the itf can report that comprehensive policy documents have been provided by the icaa and the previous insurance policy has been cancelled
summary: No breaches of unmik procurement rules or the abovementioned agreement could be identified in the purchase of the new policy through the icaa. No evidence of improper collusion or negotiations during the requisitioning process.

cleaned_summary: alleged violations of procurement procedures insurance no in april the investigation task force itf received information alleging possible violations of unmik procurement procedures involving the purchase of insurance cover for the pristina airport commencing as of april this insurance was obtained by unmik with the assistance of the icelandic civil aviation administration icaa an agreement between unmik and the icaa of april specified the procedures as follows unmik shall with the assistance of iceland as described in wpvii of schedulevi if requested obtain and maintain appropriate insurances for the airport its equipment facilities operations and services from reputable insurers unmik shall as and when reasonably required by iceland provide iceland with satisfactory evidence of such insurance wpv reads icaa will provide assistance in acquiring liability insurance to cover the operation at pristina airport the icaa will use results from similar activitiesfor acquiring liability insurance for icelandic airports most of the activities will be performed in iceland
summary: Investigation task force received information alleging possible violations of unmik procurement procedures involving the purchase of insurance cover for the pristina airport commencing as of april.

cleaned_summary: alleged misappropriation of funds manager case no the investigation task force itf has been investigating an allegation regarding administrative irregularities regarding the insurance coverage for pristina airport by a londonbased company who then purchased the cover from insurance company between and based on extensive documentation obtained from unmik pillar ii the kosovo trust agency kta and public enterprise airport pristina peap the itf determined that the responsible manager did not undertake efforts in or to invite international tenders for the airports insurance coverage according to unmik regulations finance administration instruction on public procurement using kosovo consolidated funds and in view of the cost of the premiums of more than usd such a tender should have been undertaken the manager did not prepare an international tender for at least the period october to october instead he concluded a contract in favour of insurance company effecting insurance coverage pertaining to pristina international airport for a further year it should be considered as to whether this conduct demonstrates probable cause with regard to the waste or misappropriation of public funds such an issue should be determined by a review of the matter by the department of justice
summary: The investigation task force itf has been investigating an allegation regarding administrative irregularities regarding the insurance coverage for pristina airport. The manager did not prepare an international tender for at least the period october to october instead he concluded a contract in favour of insurance company.

cleaned_summary: in the iau memo reference is made to a letter of complaint dated from vendor a company that competed for the tender and that was subsequently awarded the single source contract to supply summer uniforms the author of the letter vendor manager alleged the existence of rumours and witnesses in the matter of the bribery of procurement officer pristina airport and the finance officer pristina airport by one of vendor managers competitors in the tender process vendor vendor managers letter also identified his intention to seek legal action against procurement officer for allegedly violating the procurement rules by replacing a member of the bid evaluation committee in the competitive tender allowing a member of the finance department the finance officer to sit on the committee and favouring vendor in the tender process
summary: Vendor manager alleged the existence of rumours and witnesses in the matter of the bribery of procurement officer pristina airport and the finance officer.

cleaned_summary: investigation details procurement officer managed the competitive tender for the supply of uniforms in addition to vendor vendor and vendor submitted bids following which procurement officer convened and chaired a bid opening committee on present in addition to the committee that comprised members of the various airport work groups were representatives of the three bidding companies including vendor manager procurement officer also formed and chaired a bid evaluation committee to assess the offerings of the competitors which comprised a range of uniforms and accessories for the various categories of airport employees on the committee though not satisfied with all vendor s samples tentatively decided in favour of that company the median bidder in terms of price vendor was the highest bidder the committee resolved that vendor would be approached to determine the feasibility of nocost design changes to one of the uniforms for women employees the committee reconvened on at the request of pristina airport official during the meeting pristina airport official announced the cancellation of the tender pristina airport official later awarded a singlesource procurement contract for summer uniforms for newly hired staff in the amount of to vendor which had supplied uniforms to the airport under two previous contracts
summary: Pristina airport official awarded a contract for summer uniforms for newly hired staff in the amount of to vendor which had supplied uniforms to the airport under two previous contracts.

cleaned_summary: allegation that procurement officer replaced a member of the bid evaluation committee procurement officer explained to the itf that the original nominee to the committee committee member had not been at work on the day that the committee first convened and therefore had been replaced by committee member who then attended the second session for continuity purposes committee member and committee member confirmed procurement officer s explanation for the replacement allegation that procurement officer inappropriately included the finance officer in the bid evaluation committee the finance officer procurement officer and pristina airport official told the itf that the finance officer participated on the bid evaluation committee however procurement officer and pristina airport official each said that the other had nominated the finance officer to the committee kta legal staff advised the itf that the wisdom of allowing a representative of the finance department to participate in bid evaluations is questionable because generally officers whose function involves payment should not evaluate contractors to whom payment will become due according to kta legal staff however such participation is not precluded by any rule or law section of finance administration instruction no revised december public procurement using kosovo consolidated budget funds precludes only an approving officer from the procuring entity who will eventually sign a contract from serving as a tender evaluator the finance officer was not an approving officer in this procurement process and therefore was not prevented from serving as an evaluator
summary: procurement officer and pristina airport official told the itf that the finance officer participated on the bid evaluation committee. Finance officer was not an approving officer in this procurement process and therefore was not prevented from serving as an evaluator.

cleaned_summary: when asked by the itf to substantiate hisher allegation that procurement officer and the finance officer had accepted bribes from vendor vendor manager said that heshe had heard the rumours in pristina coffee bars but that heshe could not remember from whom heshe had heard these rumours heshe said that the witnesses to whom heshe had referred in his letter of complaint were actually the same persons from whom heshe heard the rumours vendor manager was unable to suggest which representative of vendor had paid the bribes vendor employee who attended the meeting of the bid opening committee vendor manager and vendor director all told itf that they had not paid bribes to procurement officer andor the finance officer procurement officer and the finance officer both denied accepting bribes or any other consideration from any person in this matter
summary: Vendor vendor manager said that heshe had heard the rumours in pristina coffee bars. Vendor employee who attended the meeting of the bid opening committee vendor manager and vendor director all told itf that they had not paid bribes.

cleaned_summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik including official and official pillar ii supervised the department of transport and infrastructure doti official the doti was later known as the transport sector of the unmik directorate of infrastructure affairs doti official left unmik at the end of june doti official was recruited by the doti as an international staff member on july in charge of airport operations reporting to doti official and continued in this role until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from the armed forces of a united nations member state specifically airport engineer airport engineer and airport engineer and later by the consultant from the consulting firm
summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik including official and official pillar ii. until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from the armed forces of a united nations member state.

cleaned_summary: the evaluation report also concluded that the company vendor has one manufacturer in peja which cant offer the required quality and had too long a date for completion in the case of vendor the evaluation report states that the company provided an incomplete offer when asked in what manner the offer was incomplete in interview the procurement officer a member of the evaluation committee stated that vendor submitted an offer which did not contain all the required articles the procurement officer was asked why hisher explanation was not put in the tender evaluation heshe replied that it was due to hisher lack of english in view of the fact that the evaluation committee all signed the evaluation report they would have been aware of the reason for vendor s rejection
summary: The evaluation report also concluded that the company vendor has one manufacturer in peja which cant offer the required quality and had too long a date for completion. The procurement officer was asked why hisher explanation was not put in the tender evaluation he replied that it was due to hisher lack of english.

cleaned_summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik including official and official department of transport and infrastructure doti official was also involved in the matter the doti was later known as the transport sector of the unmik directorate of infrastructure affairs doti official left unmik at the end of june doti official was recruited by doti as an international staff member on july in charge of airport operations reporting to doti official and continued in this role until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from one un member states army specifically airport engineer airport engineer and airport engineer and later by a consultant from the consulting company
summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik. until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from one un member states army specifically airport engineer airport engineer and airport engineer.

cleaned_summary: until the end of june responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik including official and official department of transport and infrastructure doti official was also involved in the matter the doti was later known as the transport sector of the unmik directorate of infrastructure affairs doti official left unmik at the end of june doti official was recruited by doti as an international staff member on july in charge of airport operations reporting to doti official and continued in this role until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from one un member states army specifically airport engineer airport engineer and airport engineer and later by a consultant from the consulting company on july the responsibility for the administration of the airport passed from pillar ii to the kosovo trust agency kta and pillar iv the divisional manager was appointed under himher were the peap official and official on april pristina international airport which had until that time been under the jurisdiction of kfor was handed over to civilian jurisdiction under icao regulations it is against this background of change that procurement procedures relating to the following contract have been examined
summary: Until the end of july responsibility for the administration of the pristina airport was entrusted to the civil administration pillar pillar ii of unmik. until september engineering expertise was provided by a series of engineers seconded from one un member states army specifically airport engineer.

cleaned_summary: allegation it is alleged that two further small quantities of uniforms in the sums of and were purchased without any supporting documents or justification two invoices dated july and august indicate that two quantities of and tshirts respectively were ordered with a value of and respectively when asked about these extra purchases the peap official stated that heshe assumed the airport hired some students and temporary staff for three months and that the tshirts were for them to wear the peap official subsequently produced two written requests from the security official for the two orders dated july and august
summary: Two invoices dated july and august indicate that two quantities of and tshirts respectively were ordered with a value of and respectively. allegation it is alleged that two further small quantities of uniforms in the sums of and were purchased without any supporting documents or justification.

cleaned_summary: when asked why two orders were placed within one month of one another rather than together the peap official stated that the airport had run out of tshirts and therefore purchased them from the same company in order to have the same design of tshirt this explanation is not a credible one since it suggests that the airport did not have any idea as to the numbers of temporary staff being taken on over a period of only three months if this was the case it indicates poor management an alternative could be that two orders were placed to avoid having to organise a competitive bidding procedure since the limit for single source procurements at that time was
summary: The airport did not have any idea as to the numbers of temporary staff being taken on over a period of only three months. when asked why two orders were placed within one month of one another rather than together the peap official stated that the airport had run out of tshirts.

cleaned_summary: in addition the two requests specify that the shirts should be the same as the previous shirts of the existing workers this requirement suggests that vendor who had just won a tender for the provision of summer uniforms to pristina airport in april had already been chosen as the supplier the security official stated that heshe had been asked to write a request for uniforms by the divisional manager following a conversation between them on the need for uniforms for the student workers when asked why heshe had addressed the two requests to the peap official rather than the divisional manager heshe replied that this was because the peap official was hisher superior however neither of the requests mentions that the security official has spoken to the divisional manager
summary: Security official stated that heshe had been asked to write a request for uniforms by the divisional manager. The two requests specify that the shirts should be the same as the previous shirts of the existing workers this requirement suggests that vendor who had just won a tender for the provision of summer uniforms to pristina airport had already been chosen as the supplier.

cleaned_summary: methodology this investigation was conducted pursuant to executive decision no on the establishment of the investigation task force the itf investigators conducted an enquiry into the allegations raised by conducting interviews with all relevant persons obtaining documents from the pristina airport administration and from the pillar iv administration which were then analysed for relevance to the inquiry at hand background information pristina international airport constitutes a state owned enterprise under yugoslavian law the assets of the airport include the runways terminal buildings hangar fuel storage facilities and equipment during the period covered by this investigation from until they were maintained by the public enterprise airport pristina peap in cooperation with military units of the kosovo force kfor pursuant to united nations security council resolution dated june and unmik regulation no dated july unmik is mandated to administer the territory of kosovo including state owned and publicly owned assets this includes pristina international airport
summary: Pristina international airport constitutes a state owned enterprise under yugoslavian law. The assets of the airport include the runways terminal buildings hangar fuel storage facilities and equipment.

cleaned_summary: a bid evaluation report dated december indicates that firms were issued with documents and bids were submitted the bids were opened on november the report indicates at page that vendor s offer in the sum of was almost twice as much as the other two bids from vendor and vendor which were rejected the reason specified for rejection of the bid by vendor on page four of the evaluation was that the evaluation committee asked the company to produce a specimen of each type of uniform and it failed to do so this is confirmed in a letter to vendor dated november a similar letter was delivered to vendor
summary: Bid evaluation report dated december indicates that firms were issued with documents and bids were submitted. Report indicates at page that vendor s offer in the sum of was almost twice as much as the other two bids from vendor and vendor which were rejected.

cleaned_summary: iii methodology this investigation was conducted pursuant to executive decision no on the establishment of the investigation task force the itf investigators conducted an enquiry into the allegations raised by interviews with persons indicated to be witnesses and persons potentially implicated in the allegations by obtaining documents from the pristina airport administration and from pillar iv which were then analysed for relevance to the inquiry at hand iv background information pristina international airport constitutes a state owned enterprise under yugoslavian law the assets of the airport include the runways terminal buildings hanger fuel storage facilities and equipment during the period covered by this investigation from until they were maintained by the public enterprise airport pristina peap in cooperation with military units of the kosovo force kfor pursuant to united nations security council resolution dated june and unmik regulation no dated july unmik is mandated to administer the territory of kosovo including state owned and publicly owned assets this includes pristina international airport
summary: The investigation was conducted pursuant to executive decision no on the establishment of the investigation task force the itf investigators conducted an enquiry into the allegations raised by interviews with persons indicated to be witnesses and persons potentially implicated in the allegations.

cleaned_summary: conclusions although peap official as the responsible official at that time denied that heshe had requested vendor representative support for the fids supply and cabling procurements vendor representative granted the itf that heshe acted on peap officials request nevertheless peap official bears the overall responsibility for hisher department peap and this investigation proved again that heshe did not fully meet the requirements as manager in a sensitive area like the airport the entire matter has to be seen as an administrative irregularity it is obvious that international procurement rules had been breached but the procurement regulation that was in force at that time financial agreement does not indicate cases like described before furthermore to prove a possible case of corruption there are not enough indications
summary: The investigation proved again that heshe did not fully meet the requirements as manager in a sensitive area like the airport. International procurement rules had been breached but the procurement regulation that was in force at that time does not indicate cases like described before.

cleaned_summary: allegation an official of a nonairport related company supported the procurement process for the supply of the flat information display system fids by writing the recommendation and justification for a single source procurement and also defined the technical specifications as vendor was only able to supply but not to cable the fids another tender had to be launched for the fids cabling winner of this tender was vendor background information the single source procurement purchase and supply of fids started on october with a written recommendation and justification by vendor representative the purchase of additional fids became necessary because of the expansion of the passenger terminal building the already existing system had been provided by vendor therefore the airport management decided to choose vendor again the capital expenditure approval and contract were signed on december the procurement file does not show why vendor only delivered the fids but did not cable it the need for cabling the fids resulted in another tender that commenced in march according to the procurement file it appeared that vendor won the competitive shopping tender with an amount of euro
summary: Vendor was only able to supply but not to cable the fids. Another tender had to be launched for the fid cabling winner of this tender was vendor.

cleaned_summary: investigative details the airport engineer was interviewed on october as heshe is the responsible person to suggest new projects to the airport management the airport engineer stated that heshe was at no time involved in the fids purchase and did not request the support by vendor representative with regard to recommend and justify the fids supply the airport engineer only recommended the cabling of the fids in a note to the airport management all following procedures are under the responsibility of the procurement unit and the management the sales manager of vendor was interviewed on the phone on august asked why vendor did not provide with the cabling of the fids heshe stated that vendor s management did not allow traveling to kosovo at that time for security reasons the sales manager of vendor also mentioned that the airports contact person with regard to the fids cabling was for himher vendor representative
summary: The airport engineer was interviewed on october as heshe is the responsible person to suggest new projects to the airport management. The airport engineer stated that heshe was at no time involved in the fids purchase and did not request the support by vendor representative with regard to recommend and justify fids supply.

cleaned_summary: pristina airport alleged administrative irregularity regarding an xray tender allegation on the th may the divisional manager kosovo trust agency kta unmik eu pillar iv approved and signed a contract between pristina airport and the vendor before the capital expenditure was formally approved by kta background information on march pristina airport launched an international tender to supply xray equipment on april the evaluation committee awarded the contract to the vendor who had not submitted the lowest tender but was the only company that met the rigorous technical specifications the vendor is acknowledged as a worldclass company specializing in such equipment the contract between pristina airport and the vendor was concluded on april it is not clear when the vendor signed this document the kta internal auditor expressed concerns over the conclusion of the contract which resulted in the divisional manager signing on behalf of the procuring entity on may kta official also signed the contract but did not record the date against hisher name the capital expenditure approval dated june was signed by kta official on june
summary: Pristina airport alleged administrative irregularity regarding an xray tender allegation on the th may the divisional manager kosovo trust agency kta unmik eu pillar iv approved and signed a contract. The capital expenditure approval dated june was signed by kta official on june.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details the charges themselves as calculated by the airport handling services department for airline flights were scrutinized against the published price list for basic airport services issued on january details recorded on the load sheets confirmed the handling charge of euros was also found to be correct the landing charge of was however reduced by as this flight was identified as a humanitarian flight and as such qualified for the discount the official of the passenger handling services pristina airport told the itf investigators that she regarded the returning kosovars as refugees and the discount as appropriate the itf investigators checked this matter with the official of the airport general services who confirmed heshe was aware of this discount and did not dispute this interpretation of the flight
summary: The charges themselves as calculated by the airport handling services department for airline flights were scrutinized against the published price list for basic airport services issued on january. Details recorded on the load sheets confirmed the handling charge of euros was also found to be correct. The landing charge of was however reduced by as this flight was identified as a humanitarian flight and as such qualified for the discount.

cleaned_summary: iv findings and conclusions there is no evidence that the airline have sought to avoid any charges levied by pristina airport all charges levied upon the airline by pristina airport for incoming and outgoing flights have been paid and receipts issued the charges applied to the airline flights are in accordance with listed charges for services the identification of the flight as humanitarian is a matter for closer review by airport pristina management to ensure compliance with airport charges the recently appointed senior official of the pristina airport when advised by the itf of the number of cash transactions was unaware that this practice continued within the passenger handling services department the information as to a credit arrangement for the airline was also provided to the pristina airport senior official by the itf for hisher action the charges shown in the price list for basic airport services correspond with those charged to the airline in addition the audit trail in respect of the cash handling receipts recording and reconciliation with the cashbooks and airports records showed no discrepancies
summary: All charges levied upon the airline by pristina airport for incoming and outgoing flights have been paid and receipts issued. Charges applied to the airline flights are in accordance with listed charges for services. The identification of the flight as humanitarian is a matter for closer review by airport management.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details the itf reviewed the conventional checkin procedures at the pristina airport and confirmed they complied with observations provided by the senior official of the pristina airport in response to a management letter dated may on the financial audit from auditing company an extract of the advice states the following management comment full integration will be achieved by the new system at present passenger and baggage checkin and boarding is automatically connected to the load sheet the load sheet contains all relevant facts concerning the flight including type and quantity of passengers this report is signed by airport load control staff compared to a headcount on board the aircraft conducted by aircraft staff and is thereafter signed by the pilot before takeoff a copy of this confirmed report is used as a basis for invoicing we use the information that later will be retrieved automatically by the new system the possible loss of revenue of departing passenger taxes is another matter requiring attention from airport management
summary: The itf reviewed the conventional checkin procedures at the pristina airport and confirmed they complied with observations provided by a senior official of the airport. The possible loss of revenue of departing passenger taxes is another matter requiring attention from airport management.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details the itf reviewed the conventional checkin procedures at the pristina airport and confirmed they complied with observations provided by the senior official of the pristina airport in response to a management letter dated may on the financial audit from auditing company an extract of the advice states the following passenger fees observation in the process of modernization of the airport entity has acquired and implemented a socalled automatic checking system this system provides accurate evidence of passengers arriving and departure however pa has still not integrated andor connected the automatic checking system with financial reporting establishment of an integrated system could provide efficient monitoring controls and accurate evidence completeness and reconciliation of the number of passenger recorded by the automatic checking system and the revenue from passenger fees in the financial statement
summary: The airport has acquired and implemented a socalled automatic checking system. The system provides accurate evidence of passengers arriving and departure. However pa has still not integrated andor connected the automatic Checking system with financial reporting.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details itf investigators asked the official of the passenger handling services pristina airport to describe the airport tax obligations for such flights the official stated that the tax of per passenger is payable in respect of departing passengers only the official explained that this tax is normally collected by the airlines using the checkin facilities as part of normal boarding procedures heshe explained that the security guards and uk immigration staff who remained airside awaiting return to the uk had not technically entered the airport and as such were not liable for airport taxes in respect of the other departing passengers the official said there was no obligation for the payment of this tax because neither the carrier nor the passengers used the regular checkin facilities of the airport
summary: The tax of per passenger is payable in respect of departing passengers only. This tax is normally collected by the airlines using the checkin facilities as part of normal boarding procedures. The security guards and uk immigration staff who remained airside awaiting return to the uk had not technically entered the airport.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details other passengers departing with the airline met in the airport public lounge their identities were checked against a list provided by an unmik civpol officer in consultation with the immigration representative they then went through conventional immigration and xray searches and were escorted into the departure lounge before boarding the airline aircraft they did not however pass through regular checkin procedures at any time itf investigators reviewed all paperwork relating to this flight an official of the passenger handling services pristina airport provided the receipt book used to evidence cash payments for landing handling and airport passenger taxes it was noted that other airlines particularly those not visiting pristina on a regular basis pay in cash for handling services details shown on the records provided by pristina airport officials were reconciled with this receipt book the dates amounts and breakdown of charges were confirmed the pilot is required to sign the receipt book and the itf verified the recorded signature against the airline load sheets as genuine
summary: Other passengers departing with the airline met in the airport public lounge their identities were checked against a list provided by an unmik civpol officer. They then went through conventional immigration and xray searches and were escorted into the departure lounge before boarding the airline aircraft.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details airline official explained that the airline paid cash for handling and landing charges to the pristina airport passenger handling services department on each occasion his aircraft used the airport airline official explained that heshe had endeavored to open a credit account with pristina airport but without success the itf sought the assistance of the security officer at pristina airport in order to monitor airline passenger movements on july itf investigators monitored the airlines inward and outward flights and related airport activities it was noted that whilst the arriving kosovar passengers went through immigration procedures before entering into the arrivals lounge the security escorts and the representative of the related immigration department remained airside at all times awaiting instructions to return to the aircraft they did not enter the terminal building
summary: The airline paid cash for handling and landing charges to the pristina airport passenger handling services department on each occasion his aircraft used the airport airline official explained that heshe had endeavored to open a credit account with the airport but without success.

cleaned_summary: iii investigative details itf investigators obtained a number of documents from pristina airport officials including records of funds received from the airline for the period january to june these funds are broken down into handling landing airport passenger and departure tax the schedule also lists the individual airport receipt number recorded for each cash payment there was no record of the airline having paid airport tax itf investigators spoke to both official and official of the airline and requested copies of receipts issued by pristina airport in respect of fees paid by the airline to the airport as well as the aircraft load sheets for may and june these documents record details such as the weight of the aircraft including the mtow maximum take off weight
summary: Itf investigators obtained a number of documents from pristina airport officials including records of funds received from the airline for the period january to june. There was no record of the airline having paid airport tax.

cleaned_summary: ii background information the airline flies to pristina airport from a european airport every thursday carrying kosovar passengers who have been found to enter the referred european state illegally the airline is contracted with the foreign states immigration department a representative of the immigration department and or more securicor security staff routinely escort the passengers on the flights to pristina on the return leg to the mentioned state the airline flight carries passengers from pristina consisting of the returning securicor escorts the representative of immigration and in addition a number of police officers of the concerned state currently working for unmik civpol these civpol officers travel to the uk without payment but with the knowledge and approval of both airline and the uk immigration department
summary: The airline flies to pristina airport from a european airport every thursday carrying kosovar passengers. The airline is contracted with the foreign states immigration department. A representative of the immigration department and or more securicor security staff routinely escort the passengers.

cleaned_summary: itf investigators visited the border boundary police and interviewed two current investigators neither officer recalled the incident but they made extensive enquiries in an attempt to trace the police report and locate the they were unsuccessful on both counts on september the itf sent a letter to unmik police officer in an effort to determine what investigations had been undertaken into the matter the result of those investigations and the whereabouts of the money the unmik police officer indicated that regional crime squad pristina region was undertaking an investigation into the matter which therefore remains an open investigation
summary: itf investigators visited the border boundary police and interviewed two current investigators neither officer recalled the incident. itf sent a letter to unmik police officer in an effort to determine what investigations had been undertaken into the matter.

cleaned_summary: investigation details analysis of the note written by the peap official suggests that the company referred to in his note as escavator is in fact company who won the contract for the construction of the new car park at pristina airport and whose representative attended a meeting in the peap officials office one day prior to the discovery of the money the sum of alleged to have been left in the envelope is unusual since one would expect the sum to have been a round sum such as it should be noted that an interoffice memorandum from a former airport engineer to the kta procurement specialist dated september alleged that the peap official had accepted an open envelope of documents relating to the car park tender from company after the time for submission of bids had concluded and contrary to accepted procurement procedures on the handling of bids this allegation is addressed in itf case no
summary: An investigation details analysis of the note written by the peap official suggests that the company referred to in his note as escavator is in fact company who won the contract for the construction of the new car park at pristina airport. The sum of alleged to have been left in the envelope is unusual.
